brazil sarney meets strikes with show of force with troops in place in brazil ports and oil installations the government of prersident jose sarney today sought to end wave of labour unrest by show of force yesterday the government sent thousands of troops supported in some instances by tanks to occupy nine oil refineries and six areas of oil production the state oil company petrobras requested the intervention because of threatened strike by 55 000 oil industry employees the government had already dispatched more than 000 marines to occupy the country main ports after national seamen strike was ruled illegal last friday the strike by 40 000 seamen now in its 13th day represents stern challenge to the government the stoppage has delayed exports at time when brazil desperately needs foreign exchange it was deterioration in the country trade balance which precipitated brazil current debt crisis and the decision on february 20 to suspend interest payments on 68 billion dlrs of commercial debt there was no sign today of an early end to the seamen strike which has badly hit the port of santos the most important in south america and the country other main ports small groups of marines armed with submachineguns stand on the quays near the strike bound ships but the military presence here is generally discreet total of 800 marines are inside the docks but most are out of sight yesterday marines and police occupied one ship the docemarte seamen leaders said after explaining to the captain that the strikers faced up to one year in jail because the strike was illegal the men returned to work one of the strike leaders elmano barbosa said it is psychological war they are using force and we are using peaceful methods port sources said only two brazilian ships in santos the docemarte and the henrique leal were working at the seamen national strike headquarters in rio de janeiro spokesmen say total of about 190 ships are strike bound in brazil and in foreign ports contradicting earlier reports from strike headquarters in rio de janeiro seamen in santos said the strikers on board ships here were not running out of food the current labour unrest is the worst faced by sarney civilian government since it came to power two years ago yesterday in separate protest hundreds of thousands of farmers held rallies directed largely against high bank interest rates the current rash of labour unrest in industry and agriculture stems from the failure of the government now collapsed cruzado plan price freeze

natural gas seen recapturing some market share higher crude oil prices will raise demand for natural gas helping it to reclaim market share lost to heavy oil when prices plunged in 1986 analysts said the analysts said that these efforts will be most successful in the industrial sectors of the economy with large and growing energy requirements natural gas stands good chance to recapture the share of oil supplied to electric utilities that it lost to the residual fuel industry last year michael smolinski an energy economist with data resources inc told reuters an estimated 200 000 barrels per day of residual fuel went into the utilities market at the expense of natural gas last year when world oil prices plunged smolinski said assuming oil prices hold above 15 dlrs barrel national average gas prices delivered to the utilities at projected 10 to 25 dlrs per mln btu would be very competitive michael german vice president of economic analysis at american gas association said the average delivered prices at the end of january were 10 dlrs per mln btu compared with 26 dlrs year ago we expect natural gas to regain 250 to 400 billion cubic feet of demand in the overall energy market in the second and third quarter 1987 he said in addition to price competitiveness availability will be an important factor persuading energy users to switch to gas frank spadine senior energy economist with bankers trust corp in new york noted spadine said the mild winter in many parts of the north american continent has led to build up of gas inventories and less would be necessary to replenish underground storage this spring freeing gas for spot sales these forecasts develop strong counterpoint to the fears that natural gas suplies would be tight and prices significantly higher given sharp decline in drilling last year aga german contended that despite the drilling decline much of proved reserves could be brought to production quickly through developments such as the infill drilling which permits more wells to be drilled in proved reserve basins citing recent eia statistics german said the gas surplus was likely to contract from three trillion cubic feet in 1986 to two trillion cubic feet in 1987 but the surplus would not go away until 1990 smolinski of data resources agreed that the surplus would persist until 1990 while gas supplies may tighten in certain consuming areas notably in california and in the northeast an overall shortfall appeared remote

saudi february crude output put at mln bpd saudi crude oil output last month fell to an average of mln barrels per day bpd from mln bpd in january gulf oil sources said they said exports from the ras tanurah and ju aymah terminals in the gulf fell to an average mln bpd last month from mln in january because of lower liftings by some customers but the drop was much smaller than expected after gulf exports rallied in the fourth week of february to mln bpd from mln in the third week the sources said the production figures include neutral zone output but not sales from floating storage which are generally considered part of country output for opec purposes saudi arabia has an opec quota of 133 mln bpd under production restraint scheme approved by the 13 nation group last december to back new official oil prices averaging 18 dlrs barrel the sources said the two fold jump in exports last week appeared to be the result of buyers rushing to lift february entitlements before the month end last week high export levels appeared to show continued support for official opec prices from saudi arabia main crude customers the four ex partners of aramco the sources said the four exxon corp lt xon mobil corp lt mob texaco inc lt tx and chevron corp lt chv signed long term agreement last month to buy saudi crude for 17 52 dlrs barrel however the sources said the real test of saudi arabia ability to sell crude at official prices in weak market will come this month when demand for petroleum products traditionally tapers off spot prices have fallen in recent weeks to more than one dlr below opec levels saudi arabian oil minister hisham nazer yesterday reiterated the kingdom commitment to the december opec accord and said it would never sell below official prices the sources said total saudi refinery throughput fell slightly in february to an average mln bpd from mln in january because of cuts at the yanbu and jubail export refineries they put crude oil exports through yanbu at 100 000 bpd last month compared to zero in january while throughput at bahrain refinery and neutral zone production remained steady at around 200 000 bpd each

outlook financial analysts said the increase of 319 000 in non farm payroll employment during february was above market expectations for rise of 170 000 to 200 000 jobs and sparked selling in treasury leiner the 101 32 level in the june bond contract had been the top of three month trading range which when penetrated during the rally wednesday led to bullish forecasts by chartists but analysts ftc urges veto of georgia gasoline station bill the federal trade commission said its staff has urged the governor of georgia to veto bill that would prohibit petroleum refiners from owning and operating retail gasoline stations the proposed legislation is aimed at preventing large oil refiners and marketers from using predatory or monopolistic practices against franchised dealers but the ftc said fears of refiner owned stations as part of scheme of predatory or monopolistic practices are unfounded it called the bill anticompetitive and warned that it would force higher gasoline prices for georgia motorists

britoil sees lower exploration expenditure britoil plc lt btol exploration expenditure for the in 1987 was likely to be only about third of the level in 1986 though overseas expenditure would remain approximately the same chief executive david walker said he told reporters following the release of the company 1986 figures that project expenditure would also remain at 1986 levels project expenditure in 1986 rose to 208 mln stg from 184 mln while exploration expenditure dropped to 87 mln from 156 mln overseas exploration fell to 28 mln from 58 mln in 1985 earlier britoil posted drop in pretax profit for 1986 to 134 mln stg from 759 mln in 1985 before an extraordinary charge of 50 mln stg on the company assets the results were slightly better than analysts forecast and the share firmed to 231p from 222p at last night close chairman sir philip shelbourne said the collapse in the oil price in 1986 had made the period extremely difficult but the company had come through remarkably well provided the recovery in oil prices was maintained the conditions would be right for substantially improved performance this year he added that the firmness of oil prices in march when they were normally weaker made him bit encouraged about the prospects for future levels walker added that britoil would feel confident if the price stayed within band of 15 dlrs to 20 dlrs barrel britoil had received some 100 responses to its announcement of desire to sell the assets and was asking for bids by the latter part of april end year reserves rose to 603 mln barrels of oil compared with 503 mln previously however walker noted that this included revised definition of reserves if 1985 figures were restated along the same lines the reserve figure would show drop from 720 mln barrels previously gas reserves also eased to 568 billion cubic feet from restated 660 billion

saudi businessmen to discuss private sector saudi arabian business leaders assembled for conference aimed at thrashing out problems facing the private sector of the kingdom oil dependent economy the meeting of some 500 top businessmen from across saudi arabia comes at time of guarded optimism in industry and commerce following the opec pact to boost world oil prices the four day conference in this resort town high in the mountains above the tihamah plain stretching to the red sea has been organised by saudi arabia chambers of commerce finance minister mohammed ali abal khail and commerce minister suleiman abdulaziz al salim will attend the first day bankers and businessmen said the conference will air problems facing commerce and industry after last year slide in oil prices and examine ways to promote higher investment in private sector sorely short of finance government planners have long recognised that saudi arabia the world largest crude exporter needs to foster private enterprise to diversify its oil based economy the fledgling private sector was hard hit by the middle east recession as early as 1983 and several big manufacturing and trading companies ran into problems repaying loans renewed optimism this year stems largely from the accord reached by opec last december to curb oil output and boost prices to benchmark level of 18 dlrs per barrel with oil prices recovering saudi arabia went ahead at the turn of the year with long delayed budget plans incorporating 52 billion riyal deficit to be bridged by drawing down foreign reserves the simple act of publishing budget restored measure of confidence to the business community some share prices have risen by more than 35 pct since last november while banks are generally reporting slowdown in the number of new non performing loans but not all bankers are convinced one senior corporate finance manager in riyadh said banks are still reluctant to lend there is certainly more optimism in the air but am not sure if it is firmly based some businessmen and bankers point out that government spending is still under tight control and the non oil economy may still be contracting capital expenditure on large projects has been cut sharply embassy report on saudi arabia published just before the budget said while industrialisation has continued to be one of the government highest priorities the recession the payments problem and the lack of financing have reduced saudi and foreign investor interest in industry it is the lack of fresh investment that is expected to be major issue among the businessmen gathered here official figures show the number of new licences for industrial ventures fell 24 pct in the six months to march 1986 compared with the same period in 1985 lending by the saudi industrial development fund major source of industry backing has fallen steadily since 1983 trading companies have also been hit some caught with huge inventories of construction equipment as recession bit some firms laid off workers and cut bloated inventories others have effectively been liquidated few have reached agreement with bankers to extend debt repayments the latest rescheduling is for the shipping to hotels conglomerate redec its negotiators have just initialled draft accord to restructure payments on billion riyals of bank debt bankers and businessmen said the conference was also likely to discuss the apparent reluctance of and british firms to step up investment in the kingdom british government delegation has just left riyadh after holding preliminary talks on ways of offsetting the huge saudi outlay on defence contract to supply 132 fighter aircraft worth five billion stg

ecuador begins work on oil pipeline to colombia construction workers today began building 26 km 16 mile pipeline to link ecuador jungle oilfields to pipeline in colombia through which ecuadorean crude could be pumped to the pacific coast ecuadorean energy minsitry officials said they said it would take about two months and at least 15 mln dlrs to build the pipeline from lago agrio in ecuador to puerto colon colombia for connection to the colombian pipeline which goes to the port of tumaco on colombia pacific ocean coast the lago agrio to puerto colon pipeline is designed to transport between 30 000 to 50 000 barrels of day bpd of ecuadorean crude to the colombian pipeline they said the colombian pipeline to tumaco has ample room for ecuadorean crude they said it is currently transporting about 17 000 bpd out of its 100 000 bpd capacity an ecuadorean energy ministry official said the ecuadorean crude reaching tumaco will be shipped by boat to ecuador for refining into oil products to meet domestic demand the completion of the pipeline would allow ecuador to resume some of production paralysed since march six by an earthquake the night before the tremor ruptured the country main pipeline from jungle oilfields to the ecuadorean port of balao on the pacific ocean ecuador was pumping about 260 000 bpd before the earthquake it would take about five months to repair the pipeline to balao government officials said ecuador estimates that it will cost between 145 to 150 mln dlrs to repair oil installations damaged by the earthquake energy ministry javier espinosa said

far east traders expect 20 dlr oil in january opec agreement to limit output to 16 mln barrels per day bpd for the rest of the year should boost spot prices and enable the group to raise its official reference price to 20 dlrs barrel in january from the current 18 dlrs far east oil industry sources said fundamentally the market situation is bullish and the official price will be 20 dlrs in january japanese refiner said the sources said that in spite of over production by opec members such as iraq the united arab emirates kuwait and qatar demand should exceed supply by the fourth quarter spot oil prices surged on friday in late trading as the market anticipated an opec agreement on second half 1987 output in early tokyo trade levels were firm at 17 30 dlrs for mideast dubai cargoes loading next month and 19 00 dlrs for brent traders said they said they expect more foreign crudes to be sucked into the market as the benchmark crude west texas intermediate wti trades at around 20 30 dlrs with wti at 20 21 or 22 dlrs refiners will import mideast and far east crudes and this will strengthen those grades further said japanese oil trader some tokyo traders were cautious about whether thu spot market has further upward potential in the short term having risen strongly on the opec news on friday you could certainly argue that if new york rose on that basis there no reason for prices to go up again today said one international oil trader in tokyo but think if there any sign of dip it will be bought back up again pretty quickly he added one oil industry analyst concurred there is no reason to expect weak market from now on he said he expected opec to raise prices to 20 dlrs when it meets on december oil sources said spot prices are unlikely to surge strongly in the next few months due to cheating by some opec members and the likelihood that saudi arabia will act as swing producer to maintain steady prices iraq is currently producing around two mln barrels per day compared to its second half quota of 54 mln they said its export capability will rise to mln bpd when new pipeline through turkey comes onstream in or around september qatar is said to be achieving sales of around 350 000 bpd against its opec assigned quota of 299 000 by discounting up to 20 cents barrel from official prices the sources said iran the united arab emirates and kuwait are also cheating on the opec agreement with over production and effective price discounts through counter purchases industry sources said but they mostly agreed that saudi arabia will unofficially act as swing producer cutting production to compensate for higher output by other members or boosting output if spot prices rise too high too fast saudi arabia has floating oil stockpile of 40 to 50 mln barrels saudi arabia wants oil price stability so the stockpile may be utilized to cool down the market if it rises too much an oil industry analyst said

indonesia limits oil price impact finance minister indonesia has minimised the economic impact of falling oil prices kept inflation within limits and boosted exports finance minister radius prawiro said indonesia was badly hit by last year steep plunge in crude prices which cut revenue from oil exports by half but prawiro was quoted by indonesian newspapers as telling president suharto that inflation was kept to around nine pct in the financial year ending tomorrow against around pct the previous year exports were estimated to have risen by seven pct he said although he did not give complete figures the depressed economy forms the main backdrop to general elections next month in indonesia major producer of rubber palm oil tin timber and coffee prawiro said 1986 87 had also been difficult because of the appreciation of currencies like the yen and the mark against the dollar which increased indonesia debt repayments he said the economy would have suffered more from the world economic recession if the government had not devalued the rupiah by 31 pct last september in an editorial on the economic outlook the jakarta post said the government must press ahead with measures to deregulate the economy to help boost non oil exports the english language daily said bigger export earnings were needed to finance not only imports but also the country growing foreign debt estimated at around 37 billion dlrs about 50 pct of our foreign debt obligations fall due within the next three to five years and will steadily increase the debt servicing burden the paper said however end investors were seen bargain hunting in expectation of further yen interest rate decline dealers said most dealers were cautious in the face of the dollar nosedive today and the possibility of interest rate rebound to halt further dollar depreciation pct coupon and volume of 400 billion yen for the april 10 year bond proposed by the finance ministry this afternoon were taken favourably by the market

mobil lt mob adds natural gas reserves in 1986 mobil corp increased net proven reserves of natural gas liquids in 1986 from the previous year according to data in its 1986 annual report the report states that total net proved reserves at year end stood at billion barrels an increase of 94 mln barrels or four pct above the previous year and detailed data show that the gains resulted from an increase in net proved reserves of natural gas liquids mobil said gains were in indonesia where sixth production facility began operation in october with capacity to manufacture mln tonnes of liquified natural gas the company also said that new capacity brought onstream last year replaced 120 pct of mobil production which declined by about four pct in 1986 from the previous year detailed data on reserves shows that net proved reserves of crude oil fell to 837 mln barrels from 853 mln barrels in 1985 natural gas liquid reserves were also lower in 1986 from the previous year net proved crude oil reserves also fell in canada to 224 mln barrels and in europe to 403 mln barrels from the previous year level of 231 mln barrels and 439 mln barrels respectively

saudi output said at year low to help opec saudi arabian oil output has fallen to its lowest level in more than year giving fresh evidence of the kingdom determination to keep oil prices at 18 dlrs barrel as agreed by opec last december oil industry sources said they said saudi output in the first eight days of march averaged mln barrels per day bpd including oil from the neutral zone shared with kuwait compared to february average of mln bpd they said saudi arabia was also selling oil from its crude oil stocks in tankers around the world which opec says must be counted towards member production quota saudi arabia quota is 133 mln bpd the lower production levels indicated saudi arabia the world largest oil exporter was insisting on getting opec official prices even at the cost of lower production the sources said king fahd reiterated yesterday in an interview with reuters and the television news agency visnews the saudi commitment to opec december pact to boost oil prices to an average 18 dlrs saudi arabia is completely sticking to opec decisions he said the sources said the kingdom exports from gulf ports averaged one mln bpd during the eight days ending last sunday down from february average of mln bpd they said saudi arabia was allowing production to fluctuate with lifting nominations and was not trying to maintain artificially high levels by putting oil into storage the kingdom main buyers the four oil firms with past stakes in the national oil company aramco mobil exxon texaco and chevron enjoy considerable flexibility in the timing and volume of their liftings but are bound to pay official prices the sources said spot market prices have firmed in the past two weeks but still remain below opec levels and major buyers have delayed liftings in the hope they would improve the sources said they expected low early march output to pick up towards the end of the month as buyers sought to fulfill their contractual obligations

world bank likely to urge changes on jakarta world bank president barber conable is expected to press indonesia the third world sixth largest debtor to maintain the momentum of economic policy changes to tackle the slump in its oil revenues western diplomats said conable who flew to indonesia yesterday from tokyo will meet with president suharto and senior economic ministers he said on arrival that the economy of south east asia largest nation was being managed well but the slump in world oil prices called for major policy adjustments today the world bank chief will visit bank funded projects in the eastern section of java indonesia most populous island he will see suharto on tuesday after day of detailed discussions with ministers tomorrow indonesia the only asian member of opec has been severely hit by last year crash in oil prices which cut its oil and gas revenues in half japan state export import bank last month agreed to provide around 900 mln dlrs in untied credits to help indonesia pay for its share of 21 world bank development projects indonesia country of 168 mln people has responded to the oil slump by cutting spending devaluing its currency by 31 pct and trying to boost exports while using foreign loans to bridge its deficit diplomats said that conable was expected to press suharto and leading economic ministers to maintain the pace of policy change particularly in dismantling indonesia high cost protected economy oil prices the debt crisis the world recession all call for major policy adjustments and external support conable said in his arrival statement but with indonesia facing parliamentary elections next month he is likely to avoid anything which would imply that the bank is demanding specific changes we believe there has been wise leadership here and the economy is being very well managed conable told reporters at jakarta airport indonesia has official and private overseas debts totalling 37 billion dlrs according to the bank which makes it the third world sixth biggest debtor it has received 10 billion dlrs from the world bank since 1968 conable did not spell out what further changes he would like to see last month the bank endorsed economic changes already introduced by indonesia but implied it wanted more giving 300 mln dlr loan in balance of payments support the bank said it will monitor progress on implementation of the government trade reform measures and supported its determination to promote efficiency and longer term growth indonesia has introduced series of measures since last may to boost non oil exports liberalise trade and encourage outside investment suharto has also ordered government committee to look into which of indonesia 215 state run companies could be sold but in report last month the embassy said the government appeared divided over how far to take its reforms western analysts say that in particular the government is unsure how far to go with dismantling indonesia high cost monopolies which control core areas of the economy central bank governor arifin siregar said this week that indonesia faced very limited economic choices it could not spend its way out of trouble because this would increase the balance of payments deficit and domestic inflation he said the main objective was to raise exports outside the oil and natural gas sector indonesia current account deficit is projected by the government to fall to 64 billion dlrs in the coming financial year which starts on april from an estimated billion in 1986 87

bp refinery due to partly re open next week the british petroleum co plc bp oil refinery at grangemouth closed after an explosion and fire eight days ago is expected to partially reopen next week refinery spokesman said he said the entire 178 500 bpd refinery has been shut since the accident which killed one person and damaged the site hydrocracker the main units will resume operation next week but the hydrocracker will be closed for an unspecified period the spokesman said the refinery had been operating at about half its capacity since end january due to overhaul work on part of the complex the overhaul is expected to end by late april

bp lt bp does not plan to hike standard lt srd bid british petroleum co plc does not intend to raise the price of its planned 70 dlr per share offer for the publicly held 45 pct of standard oil co bp managing director david simon said we don seen this as any progressive bidding game he told reporters at news conference bp now owns 55 pct of standard stock simon said bp had carefully considered the amount of its planned bid and he quoted an oil analyst whom he would not identify as saying bp careful evaluation means the company is not going to raise its offer think that an increase would be totally wrong think the price is very fair and it is much to early to speculate about ligigation he said let wait and see how the offer runs another official declined to speculate under what circumstances bp might raise its bid the bp official said the 70 dlrs share offer is times standard 1986 cash flow and 56 pct above an independent evaluation of the company assets including the value of its oil natural gas liquids and natural gas reserves he said the price royal dutch shell group lt rd lt sc paid for publicly held shell oil co shares in 1985 was times cash flow the bp official also said the 70 dlr bid is 40 pct premium over standard stock price over the past year bp group treasurer rodney chase said more than half to as much as two third of the billion dlrs bp needs for its offer will come from existing sources the rest will be financed by new debt bp will draw in cash from its operating companies around the world and is also arranging five billion dlr line of credit he explained the company debt to equity ratio will rise 11 or 12 percentage points from the current 33 pct if the offer is completed chase said but the ratio will be back below 40 pct within 12 months he added chase also said 50 to 60 pct of standard oil publicly held shares are held by financial institutions simon said standard board was informed of the offer on march nine and has been considering it since that time he said bp does not expect any regulatory problems that would delay completion of the acquisition we have informed washington of our intentions and we ve already been an integral part of ownership of oil reserves he pointed out simon said there is good chance that current world oil prices of about 18 dlrs barrel could be maintained and that the more stable market is due mostly to changes in policy in saudi arabia and other opec members to control oil production we think there are signals that current conditions are more favorable than they have been for sometime simon said we have hopes for greater stability but we do not see prices going much higher he added

the washington post today quoted john gaughan administrator of the martime administration as saying kuwait has approached an american shipping company about the possibility of charter gaughan said that earlier this week he told representatives of the company whose identify he did not know that chartered vessels flying the flag would be protected the newspaper reported concerning saudi arabia oakley said we are moving forward in our talks on how we can tailor our efforts and security cooperation to facilitate our gulf operations

india plans more bombay offshore oil wells india state owned oil and natural gas commission ongc plans to drill more wells in the bombay offshore area where well spudded in february this year gave both oil and gas an ongc spokesman said the exploratory well spudded at depth of 140 metres yielded 000 barrels of oil and 180 000 cubic metres of gas per day he said the well one of the four structures drilled in the area 80 km north west of bombay indicates good prospects of both oil and gas we ve decided to drill at least three more wells in there before starting production on commercial scale production of bombay high part of the bombay offshore field has stabilised at around 500 000 barrels per day for the last two years ongc produced 27 85 mln tonnes of crude in 1986 87 ending march up from 27 51 the previous year bombay high accounted for 20 61 mln tonnes marginally up from 20 10 the year before india total oil output is around 30 mln tonnes ongc has been exploring the bombay offshore area developed since the late 1970s for more oil as production from bombay high has reached plateau

imperial oil lt imo raises crude 32 canadian cts canadian imperial oil 70 pct exxon owned said it raised its posting for light sweet crude oil at edmonton by 32 canadian cts barrel effective today the company said its new posting for light sweet crude oil at edmonton is 25 60 canadian dlrs barrel

ecuador official seeks oil aid in venezuela ecuador deputy energy minister fernando santos alvite arrived here last night for talks on further venezuelan assistance to his country oil industry following last week earthquake officials said ecuador was obliged to suspend crude oil exports for an expected five months as result of damage to 25 miles of pipeline linking its jungle oil fields with the pacific port of balao oil normally accounts for 60 pct of its exports fellow opec member venezuela has already agreed to lend ecuador five mln barrels of crude to be repaid in kind after 180 days to help meet its domestic consumption needs

closure of bp sweden refinery forecast swedish finance ministry committee forecast that british petroleum plc lt bp may have to close its refinery in gothenburg because of an anticipated worsening of the swedish petroleum industry competitiveness it said in report that the future of the swedish refining business was bleak due to the steady drop in domestic oil consumption since the mid 1970s possible tightening of rules on sulphur content and competition from norway mongstad facility of lt den norske stats olieselskab statoil lt stat ol when its expansion is completed in the 1990s the committee said the bp refinery which lacks de sulphurisation plant was likely to be closed or sold unless costly investments were made to enhance the facility capacity to refine broader range of products but the committee noted that capacity utilisation had in recent years been above that of the european refining industry on average the bp plant in which sweden state owned lt ok petroleum ab has 22 pct started up in 1967 and has an annual capacity of mln tonnes there was nobody at british petroleum immediately available for comment

texaco canada lt txc lowers crude postings texaco canada said it lowered the contract price it will pay for crude oil 64 canadian cts barrel effective today the decrease brings the company posted price for the benchmark grade edmonton swann hills light sweet to 22 26 canadian dlrs bbl texaco canada last changed its crude oil postings on feb 19

small rise seen in gasoline inventories analysts expect the american petroleum institute weekly report on oil inventories to show slight build in stocks of gasoline for the week ended may 29 oil traders and analysts said while the consensus is for an increase few would not rule out the possibility of an decline traders said that barring any surprises in tonight report they expect the report to be neutral to bearish for oil prices heating oil stocks are also likely to build and runs to be steady to slightly higher which could add pressure on oil prices the analysts said crude oil was seen likely to build assuming imports continue at relatively high levels analysts expect gasoline stocks to rise 500 000 to two mln barrels above the 234 mln reported for may 22 peter beutel oil analyst with elders futures inc who looks for build said we have had five weeks of gasoline demand at mln bpd or more and it is likely to taper off to between mln bpd which should make stocks build demand would have to stay above mln bpd to have draw he added rising demand is why oil traders and analysts expect draw in stocks of about of about one mln barrels

venezuela to annouce partner for coal venture petroleos de venezuela will announce within two weeks the name of foreign consortium it has chosen to help exploit the coal deposits at guasare in western zulia state pdvsa president juan chacin guzman said chacin told reporters the foreign partner will provide capital as well as technical and marketing expertise to the carbozulia project which the state oil company will manage pdvsa officials said that among those who bid for the partnership is consortium between agip carbone subsidiary of italy ente nazionale idrocarburi eni and atlantic richfield lt arc of the united states minister of energy and mines arturo hernandez grisanti said discussions are currently taking place to finalize the terms of the contract with the foreign partner pdvsa vice president pablo reimpell said last week the first shipment of coal from the carbozulia project should be made during the final quarter of 1987 and would measure between 100 150 000 metric tons plans call for production to eventually reach 500 000 mt annually reimpell said the original investment in the project will be approximately billion bolivars

latest attack seen pointing up dilemmas for us military experts say the united states faces dilemma in the gulf following destruction of an iranian oil platform in retaliation for an attack on flagged tanker the experts told reuters tehran holds the initiative and is likely to control the tempo and direction of the conflict as long as america simply reacts to iranian attacks by launching limited retaliatory strikes but if washington seizes the initiative with bolder steps such as mining iran harbors blockading its shipping or destroying key bases it could find itself in major war iran is in the driver seat in an absolute sense as the cycle of attack and retaliation continues said fred axelgard gulf war expert with the private center for strategic and international studies csis it like greek tragedy said retired adm eugene carroll of washington private center for defense information cdi think tank some middle east experts say the only way out is for washington to join forces with moscow in pressing for an end to the war between iran and iraq they say it is not feasible for america to withdraw its 30 ship force from the gulf area where the navy began escorting flagged kuwaiti tankers in july withdrawal would give the appearance of being chased away by iran which president reagan could never accept defense secretary caspar weinberger told pentagon news conference the destroyers kidd young leftwich and hoel fired about 000 rounds of five inch shells at iran rostam oil rig 120 miles east of bahrain beginning at about 1400 gulf time 0700 edt on monday weinberger said the platform had been used as military base by iran and that the attack responded to an iranian silkworm missile strike on the flagged kuwaiti tanker sea isle city on friday iranians manning the platform were warned in advance and allowed to escape we do not seek further confrontation with iran but we will be prepared to meet any escalation of military action by iran with stronger countermeasures weinberger said we consider this matter closed he said analysts ranging from the liberal cdi to conservatives agreed the reaction was measured reasonable and did not escalate the conflict unduly but they said the question was whether iran would consider the matter closed it had not taken this view after earlier clashes

usx lt unit to raise most crude postings usx subsidiary marathon petroleum co said it will raise its contract prices for eleven grades of crude oil 50 cts barrel effective tomorrow the increase brings marathon posted price for west texas intermediate and west texas sour grades to 17 50 dlrs barrel the light louisiana grade was also raised 50 cts to 17 85 dlrs barrel

hamilton oil lt haml says reserves rise hamilton oil corp said reserves at the end of 1986 were 59 mln barrels of oil and 905 billion cubic feet of natural gas or 211 mln barrels equivalent up 10 mln equivalent barrels from year before

study predicts dependence on foreign oil government study has concluded the will be dependent on oil from the middle east into the next century and must take steps to reduce its vulnerability the new york times said the newspaper said the inter agency government study found serious oil dependency problem due to steadily falling domestic production and rising demand for imported oil the study concluded that by 1995 the will be relying on foreign countries for 50 pct of its oil more than the peak of 48 pct reached in 1977 and far above the 33 pct rate during the 1973 74 arab oil embargo the now imports about 38 pct of its oil needs up from 27 pct year ago the new york times said it said recommendations sent to the white house by energy secretary john harrington include financial incentives to raise domestic oil production by one mln barrels day from the current mln barrels the newspaper said the administration has placed increased emphasis on stockpiling oil reserves it said the view now held is that the strategic petroleum reserve to be tapped in times of shortages should be increased by 100 000 barrels day rather than 35 000 as called for in the 1988 budget the newspaper said harrington may propose restoring the depletion allowance to major producers the administration also plans to renew its efforts to repeal the windfall profits tax remove bars to drilling on the outer continental shelf and repeal the law that limits the use of natural gas in industrial and utility boilers it added the new york times quoted senator don nickles of oklahoma as saying the study greatly underestimated potential demand for imported oil in the next decade and overestimated the amount of domestic oil which would be produced

pdvsa to sign champlin refinery deal march 17 petroleos de venezuela said it will sign contract march 17 to buy half interest in corpus christi texas refinery and related operations the contract to be signed by pdvsa and champlin petroleum parent company the union pacific corp will create new joint venture called champlin refining the state oil company said pdvsa will pay on the order of 30 mln dlrs for the half interest in champlin energy minister arturo hernandez grisanti said wednesday the cost would be 33 mln dlrs in cash plus an additional 60 mln in crude and refined oil shipments pdvsa and union pacific have sought line of credit from group of north american and japanese banks to finance the new company working capital the venezuelan company said under the deal pdvsa will supply up to 140 000 barrels day to the refinery with the option to place 50 000 bpd more mostly gasoline and distillates through champlin distribution system in 10 states the new company will be directed by six member board with three representatives each from pdvsa and union pacific according to pdvsa venezuelans will occupy such key positions such as treasurer and vice president for manufacturing the total capacity of the champlin refinery is 160 000 bpd of crudes and another 40 000 bpd of intermediates the plant will be able to handle 110 000 bpd of venezuelan heavy crudes which make up more than half of the country crude oil exports

saudi arabia reiterates commitment to opec pact saudi arabian oil minister hisham nazer reiterated the kingdom commitment to last december opec accord to boost world oil prices and stabilise the market the official saudi press agency spa said asked by the agency about the recent fall in free market oil prices nazer said saudi arabia is fully adhering by the accord and it will never sell its oil at prices below the pronounced prices under any circumstance nazer quoted by spa said recent pressure on free market prices may be because of the end of the northern hemisphere winter season and the glut in the market saudi arabia was main architect of the december accord under which opec agreed to lower its total output ceiling by 25 pct to 15 mln barrels per day bpd and return to fixed prices of around 18 dlrs barrel the agreement followed year of turmoil on oil markets which saw prices slump briefly to under 10 dlrs barrel in mid 1986 from about 30 dlrs in late 1985 free market prices are currently just over 16 dlrs nazer was quoted by the spa as saying saudi arabia adherence to the accord was shown clearly in the oil market he said contacts among members of opec showed they all wanted to stick to the accord in jamaica opec president rilwanu lukman who is also nigerian oil minister said the group planned to stick with the pricing agreement we are aware of the negative forces trying to manipulate the operations of the market but we are satisfied that the fundamentals exist for stable market conditions he said kuwait oil minister sheikh ali al khalifa al sabah said in remarks published in the emirate daily al qabas there were no plans for an emergency opec meeting to review prices traders and analysts in international oil markets estimate opec is producing up to one mln bpd above the 15 mln ceiling they named kuwait and the united arab emirates along with the much smaller producer ecuador among those producing above quota sheikh ali denied that kuwait was over producing

china closes second round of offshore oil bids china has closed the second round of bidding by foreign firms for offshore oil exploration rights the china daily has reported it quoted spokesman for the china national offshore oil corp cnooc as saying china signed eight contracts with 15 foreign firms for blocks in the pearl river mouth and south yellow sea covering total area of 44 913 sq km second round bidding began at the end of 1984 and only one well has so far produced results lufeng 13 250 km south east of shenzhen with an output of 770 barrels day the well was drilled by group of japanese companies the spokesman added cnooc was ready to enter into contracts for offshore blocks before third round bidding began he did not say when this would be but added the contracts would not be bound by restrictions imposed during the second round china has signed 36 oil contracts and agreements with 37 companies from 10 countries since 1979 when offshore exploration was open to foreigners eleven contracts were terminated after no oil was discovered foreign firms have invested billion dlrs on offshore china since 1979

iea sees one pct growth in 1987 oecd oil demand growth in oil consumption in the western industrialised countries is likely to slow to around one pct this year compared with pct in 1986 the international energy agency iea said oil use in the 24 countries of the oecd increased by around one pct in first quarter 1987 to 35 mln bpd the iea said in its monthly oil market report growth in oecd countries is expected to come primarily from transport fuels as in 1986 but if average consumer prices are higher than 1986 the rate of growth for these fuels may be below last year pct it said the iea said that assuming crude oil and product prices stay close to current levels some destocking by end users can be expected if that happens natural gas will also regain some of the market share it lost to heavy fuel in 1986 and there may be slightly less growth in transport fuels iea estimates on april put oil stocks in the oecd area at 428 mln tonnes representing 98 days of forward consumption this is about the same level as at the begining of the year the agency said this flat trend is explained by the projected seasonal consumption decline in the second quarter of the year which offset reduction in stocks it said initial estimates indicate that company stocks fell by mln bpd in oecd countries in the first quarter of the year this followed small rise in january of mln bpd but decline of mln bpd in february and mln bpd in march it is possible that final data will show larger draw particulary for march it said as crude production also fell there is likely to have also been decline in non reported stocks particularly at sea the iea said company stocks on land in the oecd rose to 326 mln tonnes on april against 316 mln on april 1986 governments built up strategic stocks to 102 mln tonnes against 97 mln in the period the year on year trend of government stock building is continuing with year on year company stocks also rising more or less in line with consumption after declining for five years the iea noted oil stocks on land in the and canada were put at 206 mln tonnes on april down from the 214 mln tonnes on january and equivalent to 94 and 98 days of consumption respectively oil stocks in western europe were 147 mln tonnes on april down from the 154 mln on january but still equivalent to 94 days of consumption world oil supply fell in the first quarter by about two mln bpd to 45 mln bpd from 47 mln bpd in last quarter 1986 this drop was mostly due to decline in opec crude production to around 15 mln bpd in february march from 16 mln bpd in january and to the seasonal drop in exports from centrally planned economies the iea said total opec crude oil supply was 15 mln bpd in the first quarter plus mln bpd of ngls compared with 17 mln bpd of crude in the last three months of 1986 and 17 mln average for the whole of 1986 supply from non opec countries totalled 28 mln bpd against 28 mln bpd in the fourth quarter 1986 drop in saudi arabian output to tentatively forecast mln bpd in march from mln bpd in february was the largest factor behind the opec production decline the iea said saudi arabia opec assigned output quota is 133 mln bpd

bids awarded for elk hills crude oil the department of energy said it has awarded bids for about 90 000 barrels per day bpd of crude oil from the elk hills naval petroleum reserve in california the contract period runs from april one through july one the doe said successful bidders the amount of crude oil and the price per bbl according to the doe are as follows texaco inc lt tx texaco trading and transport 15 000 bpd at 15 79 dlrs and 200 bpd at 15 19 dlrs beacon oil co 000 bpd at 15 66 dlrs and 500 bpd at 16 04 dlrs golden west refining 110 bpd at 15 42 dlrs successful bidders the amount of oil and price per bbl according to the doe continue as follows chevron lt chv chevron usa inc 000 bpd at 14 51 dlrs and 000 bpd at 14 61 dlrs chevron international oil co 600 bpd at 14 41 dlrs and 800 bpd at 14 51 dlrs newhall refining co 000 bpd at 15 82 dlrs caljet inc 000 bpd at 15 32 dlrs casey co 000 bpd at 15 45 dlrs also cryssen refining inc 000 bpd at 15 47 dlrs edgington oil co 000 bpd at 15 54 dlrs sound refining inc 100 bpd at 15 51 dlrs atlantic richfield co lt arc 000 bpd at 15 75 dlrs successful bidders the amount of crude oil and the price per bbl according to the doe continue as follows orkin inc 679 bpd at 15 24 dlrs lunday thagard co 511 bpd at 15 27 dlrs golden eagle refining 500 bpd at 15 37 dlrs macmillan ring free oil co 000 bpd at 15 81 dlrs 000 bpd at 15 71 dlrs and 230 bpd at 16 02 dlrs mock resources 000 bpd at 15 76 dlrs petro diamond 000 bpd at 15 46 dlrs

saudi arabia king fahd wants stable oil prices king fahd said today saudi arabia wants oil price stability and he called on non opec producers to avoid harmful competition with the 13 nation group his plea in an interview with reuters and the television news agency visnews came ahead of state visit he will make to britain later this month king fahd was asked whether saudi arabia would be prepared to reduce its oil output below its opec quota of 133 mln barrels per day bpd to defend the 18 dlr benchmark price agreed to by opec last december the king replied saudi arabia doesn decide prices by itself but certainly desires price stability non opec countries must help us in framework of common interest so that there is no type of competition which could prove harmful to everyone he said asked if he saw the 18 dlr per barrel benchmark as first step towards higher world oil prices king fahd said it was not for saudi arabia but for all opec countries to determine such issues iran and algeria have already called for higher benchmark in recent weeks the 18 dlr level has come under pressure due partly to quota violations by some opec members king fahd said saudi arabia the world largest oil exporter was adhering to decisions made at opec december conference which set 15 mln bpd output ceiling for the first half of 1987 major non opec producer britain has so far resisted the group pleas to curb its north sea oil output the king also urged the world community to help the palestinians return to their homeland and called for peaceful end to the iran iraq war the year old war could not be resolved on the battlefield he said

petrobras sees raising export of fuel in 1987 brazil state oil company petrobras is pledging to export mln cubic meters of fuel or 28 mln barrels in 1987 company spokesman said he said that represents total sale worth 600 mln dlrs the volume is 27 pct higher over 1986 sales which totalled mln cubic meters or 22 mln barrels the united states africa and latin american are brazil main fuel buyers the spokesman said

ec watching gulf war developments the european community ec should watch very carefully for any developments in the gulf war and their consequences on the oil market ec energy commissioner nicolas mosar said today speaking two weeks after warship was attacked in the gulf mosar warned an escalation in the gulf would increase tensions in the oil market but do not want to be alarmist he told news conference after an ec energy ministers meeting in luxembourg he said the volume of ec oil imports from the gulf had declined to around 31 pct of total oil imports in the first three months of 1987 against 35 pct in the same period last year there are also other potential sources of supplies in the world he added the issue of gulf oil imports was not discussed at the ministers meeting he added ec committee of national experts in the so called oil supply group would discuss gulf oil supplies at their bi annual meeting on june 19 he said but any major decisions would have to be reserved for ec foreign ministers diplomats said west european nations have so far shown little enthusiasm for backing plan to give military protection to merchant ships in the gulf which could help insure the safety of oil supplies
shell canada said it raised crude prices by 47 canadian cts barrel today

texas petroleum acquires oil and gas properties texas petroleum corp said it issued 14 mln shares of restricted common stock in exchange for oil and gas properties and joint ventures located in the and overseas the properties were acquired from lt north american oil and gas corp and texas petroleum corp in canada the company said it added the acquisitions were the first step toward creating an oil and gas exploration and development enterprise

saudis drop condition for oil sale to brazil saudi arabia has dropped its condition that brazil secure international bank guarantees before saudia arabia would ship it oil the state oil company petrobras said in statement petrobras said the saudis will accept banco do brasil credit guarantees petrobras cancelled 40 mln dlr crude oil purchase from the saudis yesterday after they refused to accept letter of credit from the official bank of brazil the saudis had demanded that brazil get credit guarantees from leading international banks petrobras said the saudis had been advised that if they did not change their mind by monday petrobras would negotiate the purchase of oil with other producers the petrobras statement said the shipment of mln barrels will be made by the saudis on march 24 as scheduled the shipment is part contract signed in february for the saudis to supply brazil with 125 000 barrels per day until june

ecuador says will resume limited oil production ecuador will resume limited crude output next week to fill up storage tanks as first step to pump oil to colombian pipeline on may one the state ecuadorean petroleum corp cepe said cepe manager carlos romoleroux told reporters that ecuador would begin pumping an unspecified amount of crude in northeastern jungle oilfields at the end of next week in preparation to send the oil through new pipeline link up to neighbouring colombia oil production in ecuador was halted on march five when an earthquake damaged the country main pipeline from lago agrio at the heart of the ecuadorean jungle oilfields to the pacific port of balao it will take at least until the end of july to repair the pipeline and return output to normal levels the country was pumping between 245 000 bpd and 250 000 bpd before the tremor to resume limited output in the meantime ecuador is constructing 26 mile pipeline linkup capable of carrying 55 000 bpd from lago agrio to puerto colon the starting point of colombia pipeline to the pacific port of tumaco the original target date to resume limited crude output was may eight the scheduled date for the inauguration of the lago agrio to puerto colon pipeline an energy ministry spokesman said

dune resources lt dnlaf reserves rose in 1986 dune resources ltd said its oil reserves increased 225 pct during 1986 while its natural gas reserves were up six pct the company said its proven oil reserves were estimated at 605 682 barrels on december 31 up from 186 655 barrels year earlier boosted by discoveries during the year put at 423 659 barrels it said gas reserves rose to mln cubic feet from mln on dec 31 1985 as discoveries of nearly mln cubic feet were partialy offset by production of 287 391 cubic feet and downward revisions of previous estimates totaling 491 694 cubic feet

api says crude oil ouput off from year ago the american petroleum institute said that crude oil production in february declined pct from year ago levels to about mln barrels day in its monthly report on oil supplies and stocks api said that domestic demand for petroleum products as measured by products supplied continued to rise reaching 16 mln barrels day in the month up pct from february 1986 api noted the drop in crude oil output coupled with drop in natural gas liquids production which was off 11 pct from february 1986 levels represented decline in production of more than one mln barrels day api said the decline in domestic production and the rise in demand brought petroleum imports to about six mln barrels day in february 30 pct increase from last year level so far this year api said growth in domestic demand which was up pct from last year year to date level has slowed in comparison to the accelerated growth in the last half of 1986 it said crude oil production for the first two months of 1987 was off pct from the comparable year ago period while crude imports were up 30 pct

no immediate plans to close refinery esso saf esso saf lt essf pa the french subsidiary of exxon corp lt xon said it had no immediate plans to shut down one of its two refineries exxon new president lee raymond said earlier that it could decide to close french refinery an esso saf spokesman said closure was hypothesis that depended on the evolution of the market and refineries ability to make money he said port jerome west of paris and fos sur mer on the mediterranean had benefitted from new investment over 1985 86 and had last year broken even after stock losses the port jerome refinery has an annual production capacity of seven mln tonnes while fos sur mer is five mln the spokesman added industry sources said the easiest plant to dispose of would be fos sur mer because it is single refinery while the port jerome refinery is attached to wider complex comprising petrochemical plant and lubricant production plant raymond was quoted as saying in published interview that exxon was reviewing its worldwide refinery operations and might decide to close one of its french refineries

canterra energy to drill well off nova scotia lt canterra energy ltd said it will drill an exploratory well on the scotian shelf about 280 kilometers east southeast of halifax nova scotia drilling will begin in late april 1987 in 61 meters of water and will be drilled to total depth of 500 meters canterra said canterra will operate the well and has 39 pct interest in it lt petro canada inc has 26 pct lt trillium exploration corp has 20 pct and lt nova scotia resources ventures ltd has 15 pct

occidental lt oxy in big peru heavy oil find occidental petroleum corp said the shiviyacu 23 development well on block ab in the peruvian amazon jungle is producing 593 barrels of 22 degree gravity oil per day from depths of 543 to 547 and 556 to 599 feet the company said it is drilling new exploration well on the block southeast shiviyacu miles away

calumet industries lt cali sees 2nd qtr loss calumet industries inc said it expects to report loss from operations for its second quarter ending march 31 despite strong unit sales increase in the same year ago period the company reported net income of 366 953 dlrs or 18 cts share chairman mark salvino said the expected loss is primarily due to depressed product prices not recovering the increasing cost of crude oil salvino also said steadier crude prices and the reduced rate of refinery production should increase product prices and lead to return to more normal profit margins he reported that the 23 mln dlr hydrocal ii system under construction at the company refinery in princeton la is on schedule and production will begin early in fiscal 1988

naval forces attack iranian oil platform warships attacked and destroyed an iranian oil platform on monday in retaliation for friday iranian attack damaging flagged ship defense secretary caspar weinberger said when asked how much was left of the oil platform weinberger said nothing there was no iranian reaction he said we consider this matter is now closed weinberger said four destroyers attacked the platform about 120 miles east of bahrain in the central gulf with fire at 0700 edt weinberger said we chose platform used by the iranians to interfere with and be source of potential attack on convoys weinberger said at pentagon briefing we know it has been used indeed to not only launch small boat attacks on shipping but to fire on helicopters it removal will contribute significantly to the safety of forces in the future weinberger said of the navy operation to escort oil tankers through the gulf we do not seek further confrontation with iran but we will be prepared to meet any escalation of military actions by iran with stronger countermeasures weinberger said he said the 20 to 30 iranian personnel on the oil platform were given 20 minute warning to abandon the platform as far as we know they did abandon the site he said weinberger was asked why the united states had chosen to attack an oil platform rather than iranian silkworm missile platforms blamed by washington for friday attack

gulf canada lt goc acquires suez oil stake gulf canada corp said it acquired 25 pct working interest in the gulf of suez oil concession for undisclosed terms the company said its agreement with operator conoco hurghada inc and hispanoil covered the 168 374 acre east hurghada offshore concession it said 15 mln dlr four well program was planned for 1987 after the acquisition which is subject to egyptian government approval working interests in the hurghada block will be conoco hurghada at 45 pct hispanoil 30 pct and gulf canada the balance

mexican first qtr crude exports seen at 15 25 dlrs the average price of mexico crude oil exports in first quarter 1987 will be 15 25 dlrs per barrel according to preliminary figures issued in press release by the state oil company petroleos mexicanos pemex it gave no direct comparison with the year ago figure but said crude and products sales were expected to rise to 99 billion dlrs this quarter 420 mln dlrs higher than expected and 22 pct better than the year ago quarter prospects for the second quarter were relatively favourable with crude exports seen at 320 mln bpd after an expected 324 mln this month 323 in february and 395 mln in january

paribas seeking to adjust ecuador oil facility banque paribas which arranged 220 mln dlr loan for ecuador last year to pre finance oil exports wants to adjust the terms of the facility to help the country recover from devastating earthquake bankers said but the french bank plan which would effectively postpone repayment of about 30 mln dlrs of the loan for several months is running into stiff resistance from many of the 52 members of the loan syndicate the pipeline that carries all ecuador oil exports was ruptured in the march tremor and will take some five months to repair at cost of about 150 mln dlrs to repair president leon febres cordero on friday estimated total damages caused by the quake at one billion dlrs and said that ecuador as result would maintain january suspension of interest payments on its foreign commercial bank debt payments were halted in january because of the drop in the price of oil which accounts for nearly two thirds of ecuador export earnings and 60 pct of government revenue although sympathetic to ecuador plight many banks in the paribas facility feel that emergency financial relief is job for international financial organizations and not for commercial banks bankers said the 18 month oil financing facility which was signed last october 28 is one of the few purely voluntary credits for latin american nation since the region debt crisis erupted in august 1982 because it was voluntary deal many bankers feel strongly that the orginal terms must be adhered to otherwise they fear the gradual re establishment of normal market conditions for latin borrowers will be set back there lot of reluctance by the other banks they feel it different facility and so any kind of suggestion of restructuring would look bad one banker commented

malaysia advised to raise crude oil output in 1988 malaysia national oil company petronas has advised the government to raise crude oil output to 540 000 barrels day bpd in 1988 from current 500 000 bpd senior company official said we have the capacity to produce the amount rastam hadi petronas vice president for upstream sector said the government will announce its decision on friday when it unveils the country budget malaysia raised output this month to current levels from 420 000 bpd after reviewing the world oil market in may malaysia cut output to 420 000 bpd from 459 000 in response to call by opec to boost prices

opec president lukman expects short calm meeting opec conference president rilwanu lukman said he expects next week ministerial meeting in vienna to be brief and calm and that opec current price and production agreement may only need slight review expect the meeting in vienna to be short and calm lukman who is also nigerian oil minister told reporters here ahead of his departure on sunday for the conference which starts june 25 we already have an agreement which may need only slight review lukman said the agreement reached at long session of opec ministers in december last year pegged the group crude oil output at 15 mln bpd for first half 1987 at fixed prices of around 18 dlrs barrel since then prices have risen from 15 dlrs in december to just above the official opec levels with oil industry analysts firmly convinced the organisation will maintain the agreement to keep the market stable myself believe that opec will tend to take position to strengthen the gains we have made so far lukman said he declined to say if the current ceiling should be maintained or raised to 16 mln bpd for the third quarter and 18 mln for the fourth as provisionally agreed last december whatever decision we arrive at will be guided by our collective will to keep the market strong he said he said non opec member norway which he visited two weeks ago had pledged further cooperation with the group and this was significant for its members lukman said heavy destocking by consumers early this year when opec fixed price regime came into effect and restocking now for the winter was responsible for current market strength

jordan petrocanada agree oil exploration project two year project to search for oil and gas in jordan was agreed in amman by jordan natural resources authority nra and the canadian company petrocanada international assistance corporation pciac the 19 mln dlr assistance agreement was signed by jordan minister of energy hisham al khatib and pciac chairman peter towe pciac is canadian government corporation providing assistance to countries like jordan to reduce their dependence on oil imports towe said

reagan says needs to lessen oil imports president reagan said the united states must do more to lessen its reliance on imported oil president reagan said during nationally televised news conference that the rising reliance on foreign oil is problem that the administration is studying we have to study this more reagan said this is why we increased the strategic petroleum reserve but we have to do more he said reagan said his administration has already proposed deregulating natural gas and eliminating the windfall profits tax on crude oil production however he complained that congress had not yet approved those measures the department of energy earlier this week released report that warned of rising reliance on foreign oil imports at time when domestic production is declining it suggested options for the administration to consider but made no specific recommendations

uae oil minister oteiba visits egypt agency uae oil minister mana said al oteiba arrived in alexandria last night for visit to egypt the national middle east news agency mena said it said oteiba who had just attended the opec ministerial meeting in vienna would stay for several days but gave no details non opec egypt has pledged to restrain output to support opec moves to boost oil prices oil minister abdel hadi kandeel last week said egypt plans to leave its oil production of 870 000 barrels per day unchanged for the next five years egypt is able to produce up to one mln bpd

tass denounces attack on iran as adventurism the official soviet news agency tass denounced attack on an iranian oil drilling platform in the gulf on monday as military adventurism and said it would bring no dividends to the reagan administration tass commentator mikhail krutikhin said the administration had embarked on an adventurist path in order to deflect attention from the scandal in which the united states sold arms to iran and the profits were diverted to nicaraguan rebels the confrontation is fact now what is obvious is that the latest military adventure will not bring political dividends to the american administration krutikhin said soviet leader mikhail gorbachev and foreign minister eduard shevardnadze abruptly left parliamentary session earlier on monday sparking diplomatic speculation that they were concerned with an urgent matter of foreign affairs soviet officials have previously criticized the united states for sending naval forces into the gulf saying their presence serves to increase tension moscow is officially neutral in the war between iran and iraq it is major arms supplier to iraq but has also sought broader contacts with iran in the last year krutikhin said the united states has undertaken an act of armed aggression against iran the probability of which has long been spoken of by washington officials

recent oil demand up pct from year ago oil demand as measured by products supplied rose pct in the four weeks ended march 13 to 16 49 mln barrels per day bpd from 16 11 mln in the same period year ago the energy information administration eia said in its weekly petroleum status report the energy department agency said distillate demand was up pct in the period to 43 mln bpd from 33 mln year earlier gasoline demand averaged 93 mln bpd up pct from 67 mln last year while residual fuel demand was 31 mln bpd off pct from 42 mln the eia said domestic crude oil production was estimated at 36 mln bpd down pct from 10 mln year ago and gross daily crude imports excluding those for the spr averaged 70 mln bpd up 24 pct from 96 mln the eia said refinery crude runs in the four weeks were 11 92 mln bpd up pct from 11 80 mln year earlier it said year to date figures will not become available until march 26 when eia petroleum supply monthly data for january 1987 becomes available the agency said

iraq reports raids iran nowruz oil field iraq said its warplanes launched two bombing raids on iran offshore nowruz oilfield in the northern gulf today military spokesman quoted by the official iraqi news agency said platforms at the field were reduced to rubble he said attacks on the field 55 miles northwest of iran kharg island oil terminal were carried out at 0600 gmt he said today raids fall within iraq policy to deprive iranian rulers of oil revenue used to serve their aggressive aims iraqi planes yesterday raided the nearby ardeshir oil field resuming attacks on iranian targets after month long lull

shell australia reports 45 79 mln dlr 1986 profit royal dutch shell group lt rd ams unit lt shell australia ltd said its net profit fell to 45 79 mln dlrs in 1986 from 66 76 mln in 1985 revenue fell to 55 billion dlrs from 91 billion in an extremely competitive and over regulated environment chairman and chief executive kevan gosper said in statement 26 25 mln dlr annual dividend would be paid to the parent after very disappointing year return of pct on funds employed represents very meagre return in an economy suffering from inflation of around 10 pct he said gosper said the results reflected heavy reliance on downstream oil and chemicals poor coal and metal returns and the financial burden of the north west shelf gas project duties royalties and taxes rose to 37 billion dlrs against 852 72 mln in 1985 and gosper urged the government to move quickly to lift costly and unnecessary regulation it is just as important for australia to maintain financially healthy technically advanced refining and marketing industry as it is to sustain oil exploration and production he said the australian oil industry has the experience and the capacity to serve the nation and its shareholders well if the government would stop putting roadblocks in our way he said shell invested 500 mln dlrs over the past five years to upgrade its oil refining and marketing business but further investment required an appropriate rate of return he said exploration and evaluation spending in 1986 fell to 18 77 mln dlrs from 26 35 mln while investment in property and plant rose to 374 25 mln from 353 94 mln year earlier gosper said oil companies would be under intense pressure in 1987 because of forecast slow economic growth

analyst with stockbrokers kleinwort grieveson adding that total opec production in the first week of october could be above 18 mln bpd little changed from september levels peter nicol analyst at chase manhattan bank said opec production could be about 18 19 mln in october reuter and international energy agency iea estimates put opec september production at 18 mln bpd the attack was in retaliation of last friday hit of kuwaiti oil products tanker flying the flag the sea isle city it was struck by missile believed to be iranian in kuwaiti waters and was the first hit on flag commercial vessel in the seven year iran iraq war the owned liberian flag tanker sungari was hit in the area on thursday also believed struck by an iranian missile refiners were not significant purchasers of physical oil on monday as result increased gulf tension following the attack analysts said they said closure of the strait of hormuz through which around eight mln bpd passes isnlikely because it is not in the interests of the or iran they said any threat to oil supplies would stem from an increase in the number of tanker attacks as part of widening of gulf hostilities analysts said but they saw the strike as limited reply to iranian missile attacks with some describing it as responsible geoffrey pyne analyst at stockbrokers phillips and drew said he was impressed by the sensible response the has thought carefully about what would correspond to iranian agression they have proved to the iranians that any further action will be met with like for like response today action by the was not usx lt says talks ended with british petroleum usx corp chairman david roderick said the company had ended talks with british petroleum co plc lt bp about the possible sale of some energy assets and said usx has no immediate restructuring plans for its oil businesses we have terminated our discussions roderick told reuters after speech to the petroleum equipment suppliers association here he said usx was not conducting talks with any other possible buyer of its energy assets earlier today bp said it planned to offer 70 dlrs per share for the standard oil co lt srd publicly held stock usx said in december the company had held formal discussions with bp about the potential sale of some of its overseas oil assets and usx had received expressions of interest from half dozen other oil companies roderick in response to question said usx had no immediate plans to restructure its marathon oil co or texas oil and gas corp he said usx also did not plan to sell any of its 49 pct interest in the giant yates field in west texas we want to maintain our production in the yates field during these difficult times roderick added in response to question roderick also said he did not know whether australian investor robert holmes court was accumulating usx stock in recent days traders have suggested holmes court was buying additional shares roderick said carl ichan who terminated an eight billion dlr hostile takeover plan for usx in january continued to hold sizable interest in the company mr ichan still apparently has 11 pct he hasn bought any more stock or sold any roderick said he very satisfied shareholder right now talk with him monthly in his speech roderick predicted the fall in the value of the dollar would set the stage for the to solve its trade deficit problem which totaled 170 billion dlrs in 1986 expect by the early 1990s the will be running net trade surplus roderick said think the worst is over and we can look forward to stability and upward movement ahead however the usx chairman warned that european trading partners may resist the turn in the trade deficit some economic discomfort must be transferred from the united states to our friends trading partners and allies

martin of sanford bernstein co inc said there will be increasing momentum in earnings albeit not until later this year martin said at technology conference sponsored by the investment firm martin said the coming rebound reflects new product introductions in the mid range area rather than any drastic improvement in economic growth or capital spending ibm whose stock hit 52 week low of 115 dlrs in mid january has come back lately ibm was trading up at 149 dlrs analysts computer industry executives and the company itself have highlighted the external economic factors hampering ibm growth but martin said the product cycle was key to understanding the rise and fall of ibm and other computer companies and pointed to digital equipment corp lt dec to support his view by replacing the product japan business decline seen bottoming out the extended decline in japan overall business performance was likely to bottom out in the current january march quarter the finance ministry said improved corporate earnings and better prospects for the stability of the yen had made companies more optimistic it said after carrying out quarterly survey the survey conducted in february was based on questionnaires returned by 328 large and small firms in all sectors except the finance and insurance industries the survey said overall corporate earnings were expected to turn positive with an estimated pct year on year increase in the second half of fiscal 1986 ending on march 31 after pct decrease in the first half corporate earnings will grow further in the first half of fiscal 1987 rising an estimated 10 pct it added manufacturers earnings hit hard by the yen steady rise against the dollar will rise pct in first half fiscal 1987 after falling 10 pct in the second half of fiscal 1986 it said overall earnings of non manufacturing companies will rise 11 pct year on year in the first half of fiscal 1987 after growing pct in the second half of fiscal 1986 the survey said it said this figure was bolstered by profits of firms such as electric power and gas companies which have benefitted from the yen appreciation
